Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of mystery from unknowing population shifts across local community boundaries. The Netherlands discusses moral obligations to continue immigration to sustain national character. The US places monetary concerns about immigration as central.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was chasing them is feeding off their remains and will follow them back to the surface, saving themselves for its lover.
Director: Marc Schölermann
Actors: Carl preacher, David S Parker

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows many characteristics of other (beginning to hit its peak) films and tries too hard to appear modern with trendy music, but also a generic script with low budget effects; Yet love it you will.
